verses.text: Woe to the rebellious children , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that take counsel , but not of me; and that cover with a covering , but not of my spirit , that they may add sin to sin :
That walk to go down into Egypt , and have not asked at my mouth ; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh , and to trust in the shadow of Egypt !
Therefore shall the strength of Pharaoh be your shame , and the trust in the shadow of Egypt \add your\add* confusion.
For his princes were at Zoan , and his ambassadors came to Hanes.
They were all ashamed of a people \add that\add* could not profit them, nor be an help nor profit , but a shame , and also a reproach.

The burden of the beasts of the south : into the land of trouble and anguish , from whence \add come\add* the young and old lion , the viper and fiery flying serpent , they will carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses , and their treasures upon the bunches of camels , to a people \add that\add* shall not profit \add them\add*.
For the Egyptians shall help in vain , and to no purpose : therefore have I cried concerning this , Their strength \add is\add* to sit still.\f + \fr 30.7 \ft concerning…: or, to her\f* \p
¶ Now go , write it before them in a table , and note it in a book , that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever :\f + \fr 30.8 \ft the…: Heb. the latter day\f*
That this \add is\add* a rebellious people , lying children , children \add that\add* will not hear the law of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*:
Which say to the seers , See not; and to the prophets , Prophesy not unto us right things , speak unto us smooth things , prophesy deceits :
Get you out of the way , turn aside out of the path , cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.
Wherefore thus saith the Holy One of Israel , Because ye despise this word , and trust in oppression and perverseness , and stay thereon:\f + \fr 30.12 \ft oppression: or, fraud\f*
Therefore this iniquity shall be to you as a breach ready to fall , swelling out in a high wall , whose breaking cometh suddenly at an instant.

And he shall break it as the breaking of the potters’ vessel that is broken in pieces ; he shall not spare : so that there shall not be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth , or to take water \add withal\add* out of the pit.\f + \fr 30.14 \ft the potters’…: Heb. the bottle of potters\f*

For thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*, the Holy One of Israel ; In returning and rest shall ye be saved ; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength : and ye would not.
But ye said , No; for we will flee upon horses ; therefore shall ye flee : and, We will ride upon the swift ; therefore shall they that pursue you be swift.

One thousand \add shall flee\add* at the rebuke of one ; at the rebuke of five shall ye flee : till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a mountain , and as an ensign on an hill.\f + \fr 30.17 \ft a beacon: or, a tree bereft of branches, or, boughs: or, a mast\f* \p

¶ And therefore will the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* wait , that he may be gracious unto you, and therefore will he be exalted , that he may have mercy upon you: for the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add is\add* a God of judgment : blessed \add are\add* all they that wait for him.
For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem : thou shalt weep no more : he will be very gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry ; when he shall hear it, he will answer thee.

And \add though\add* the Lord give you the bread of adversity , and the water of affliction , yet shall not thy teachers be removed into a corner any more, but thine eyes shall see thy teachers :\f + \fr 30.20 \ft affliction: or, oppression\f*
And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying , This \add is\add* the way , walk ye in it , when ye turn to the right hand , and when ye turn to the left.

Ye shall defile also the covering of thy graven images of silver , and the ornament of thy molten images of gold : thou shalt cast them away as a menstruous cloth ; thou shalt say unto it, Get thee hence.\f + \fr 30.22 \ft thy graven…: Heb. the graven images of thy silver\f*\f + \fr 30.22 \ft cast: Heb. scatter\f*

Then shall he give the rain of thy seed , that thou shalt sow the ground withal; and bread of the increase of the earth , and it shall be fat and plenteous : in that day shall thy cattle feed in large pastures.
The oxen likewise and the young asses that ear the ground shall eat clean provender , which hath been winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.\f + \fr 30.24 \ft clean: or, savoury: Heb. leavened\f*

And there shall be upon every high mountain , and upon every high hill , rivers \add and\add* streams of waters in the day of the great slaughter , when the towers fall.\f + \fr 30.25 \ft high hill: Heb. lifted up, etc\f*

Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun , and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold , as the light of seven days , in the day that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* bindeth up the breach of his people , and healeth the stroke of their wound. \p

¶ Behold, the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* cometh from far , burning \add with\add* his anger , and the burden \add thereof is\add* heavy : his lips are full of indignation , and his tongue as a devouring fire :\f + \fr 30.27 \ft burden…: or, grievousness of flame\f*\f + \fr 30.27 \ft heavy: Heb. heaviness\f*

And his breath , as an overflowing stream , shall reach to the midst of the neck , to sift the nations with the sieve of vanity : and \add there shall be\add* a bridle in the jaws of the people , causing \add them\add* to err.

Ye shall have a song , as in the night \add when\add* a holy solemnity is kept ; and gladness of heart , as when one goeth with a pipe to come into the mountain of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, to the mighty One of Israel.\f + \fr 30.29 \ft mighty…: Heb. Rock\f*

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall cause his glorious voice to be heard , and shall shew the lighting down of his arm , with the indignation of \add his\add* anger , and \add with\add* the flame of a devouring fire , \add with\add* scattering , and tempest , and hailstones.\f + \fr 30.30 \ft his glorious…: Heb. the glory of his voice\f*
For through the voice of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall the Assyrian be beaten down , \add which\add* smote with a rod.

And \add in\add* every place where the grounded staff shall pass , which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall lay upon him, \add it\add* shall be with tabrets and harps : and in battles of shaking will he fight with it.\f + \fr 30.32 \ft in every…: Heb. every passing of the rod founded\f*\f + \fr 30.32 \ft lay…: Heb. cause to rest upon\f*\f + \fr 30.32 \ft with it: or, against them\f*

For Tophet \add is\add* ordained of old ; yea, for the king it is prepared ; he hath made \add it\add* deep \add and\add* large : the pile thereof \add is\add* fire and much wood ; the breath of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, like a stream of brimstone , doth kindle it.\f + \fr 30.33 \ft of old: Heb. from yesterday\f*
